revision.text:
'''Dungeons''' include forests, caves, buildings, and other places that are accessible by spending [[Dungeon Tokens]] in which wild Pokémon are encountered. Apart from the entrance fee, they differ from routes in that only 60 seconds are given to find and defeat a "boss Pokémon", after which the dungeon is considered cleared.
== How to clear == Clearing Dungeons requires active play. To enter a dungeon, select it on the Town Map and either click "Start" or press the Spacebar on the keyboard. Dungeons can be navigated either by clicking on the dungeon tiles or by using the arrow keys or WASD keys. Moving to undiscovered tiles in dungeons can reveal one of 4 things:
# '''Empty tiles''' - You can simply move onto next tile without having to do anything. # '''A wild Pokémon''' - Just like routes, these are Pokémon you can defeat and catch. Some Pokémon can only be found in specific dungeons. # '''Dungeon boss''' - This Pokémon must be defeated to clear the dungeon. It has more HP than normal encounters in any dungeon. You can either click "Start Bossfight" or press the Spacebar to start the fight. # '''A chest''' - [[Battle Items]] can be collected from chests by clicking on them or by pressing the Spacebar. Additionally, when 2 chests in the same dungeon are opened, all chest tiles are revealed. When 4 chests are opened, the entire dungeon is revealed, but each chest opened will also increase the HP of all encounters in the dungeon by 20%.
== Dungeon locations ==
=== [[Kanto]] ===
Dungeons in [[Kanto]] are 5x5 in size (25 tiles in total), contain 5 chests, 13 non-boss encounters, and 6 empty tiles.
{| class="wikitable sortable" |+ Kanto Dungeons |- ! Name !! Location !! Entry Price !! [[Category:Dungeons]]

'''Dungeons''' include forests, caves, buildings, and other places that are accessible by spending [[Dungeon Tokens]] in which wild Pokémon are encountered. Apart from the entrance fee, they differ from routes in that only 30 seconds are given to find and defeat a "boss Pokémon", after which the dungeon is considered cleared.
== How to clear == Clearing Dungeons requires active play. To enter a dungeon, select it on the Town Map and either click "Start" or press the Spacebar on the keyboard. Dungeons can be navigated either by clicking on the dungeon tiles or by using the arrow keys or WASD keys. Moving to undiscovered tiles in dungeons can reveal one of 4 things:
# '''Empty tiles''' - You can simply move onto next tile without having to do anything. # '''A wild Pokémon''' - Just like routes, these are Pokémon you can defeat and catch. Some Pokémon can only be found in specific dungeons. # '''Dungeon boss''' - This Pokémon must be defeated to clear the dungeon. It has more HP than normal encounters in any dungeon. You can either click "Start Bossfight" or press the Spacebar to start the fight. # '''A chest''' - [[Battle Items]] can be collected from chests by clicking on them or by pressing the Spacebar. Additionally, when 2 chests in the same dungeon are opened, all chest tiles are revealed. When 4 chests are opened, the entire dungeon is revealed, but each chest opened will also increase the HP of all encounters in the dungeon by 20%.
== Dungeon locations ==

[[Category:Dungeons]]

'''Dungeons''' include forests, caves, buildings, and other places that are accessible by spending [[Dungeon Tokens]] in which wild Pokémon are encountered. Apart from the entrance fee, they differ from routes in that only 30 seconds are given to find and defeat a "boss Pokémon", after which the dungeon is considered cleared.
== How to clear == Clearing Dungeons requires active play. To enter a dungeon, select it on the Town Map and either click "Start" or press the Spacebar on the keyboard. Dungeons can be navigated either by clicking on the dungeon tiles or by using the arrow keys or WASD keys. Moving to undiscovered tiles in dungeons can reveal one of 4 things:
# '''Empty tiles''' - You can simply move onto next tile without having to do anything. # '''A wild Pokémon''' - Just like routes, these are Pokémon you can defeat and catch. Some Pokémon can only be found in specific dungeons. # '''Dungeon boss''' - This Pokémon must be defeated to clear the dungeon. It has more HP than normal encounters in any dungeon. You can either click "Start Bossfight" or press the Spacebar to start the fight. # '''A chest''' - [[Battle Items]] can be collected from chests by clicking on them or by pressing the Spacebar. Additionally, when 2 chests in the same dungeon are opened, all chest tiles are revealed. When 4 chests are opened, the entire dungeon is revealed, but each chest opened will also increase the HP of all encounters in the dungeon by 20%.
== Dungeon locations ==
=== [[Kanto]] ===
Dungeons in [[Kanto]] are 5x5 in size (25 tiles in total), contain 5 chests, 13 non-boss encounters, and 7 empty tiles.

[[Category:Dungeons]]

Dungeons are Caves and other places that you can enter by paying [[Dungeon Tokens]] in which you encounter wild pokemons. The difference between routes and dungeons is that other than having to pay the entry fee you also get only 30 seconds to clear the place.
== How to clear == There is no way to do Dungeons while being idle and has to be done with active playtime. To enter a dungeon, you have to select the dungeon you want to enter and then either click "Start" or press spacebar on your keyboard. You can navigate the place by either clicking on the dungeon tiles or by using either keyboard arrow keys or WASD keys. When you click on an undiscovered tile in dungeon it can be either of the 4 things : # '''An empty tile''' - You can simply move onto next tile without having to do anything # '''A wild pokemon''' - Just like routes, these are pokemons you can defeat and catch, some pokemons can only be found in specific dungeons. # '''Dungeon Boss''' - This is the pokemon you need to defeat in order to clear the dungeon. Its the highest HP pokemon in any dungeon. You can either click "Start Bossfight" or press spacebar to start the fight. # '''A Chest''' - You can find Battle Items in chests by clicking on them or by pressing spacebar. Additionally, When you open 2 chests all the chests tiles are revealed and when you open 4 chests the whole dungeon is revealed but every chest you open will also increase the HP of any pokemon you encounter in dungeon
== Dungeon locations ==
=== Kanto ===
Dungeons in Kanto are 5x5 in size (Total 25 tiles).
{| class="wikitable sortable" |+ Kanto Dungeons |- ! Name !! Location !! Entry Price !! Moon]] || between Kanto Route 3 & 4 || 75 {{dungeontokens}} || Kabuto & Omanyte |- | [[Cerulean Cave]] || Cerulean City || 2500 {{dungeontokens}} || Rhydon & Mewtwo |- | [[Rock Tunnel]] || Between Kanto Route 9 & 10 || 500 {{dungeontokens}} || Onix |- | [[Power Plant]] || Kanto Route 10 || 1000 {{dungeontokens}} || Electabuzz & Zapdos |- | [[Pokemon Tower]] || Lavender Town || 750 {{dungeontokens}} || Marowak |- | [[Seafoam Islands]]|| between Kanto Route 19 & 20 || 1250 {{dungeontokens}} || Seel & Articuno |- | [[Pokemon Mansion]] || Cinnabar Island || 1500 {{dungeontokens}} || Magmar |- | [[Victory Road]] || Kanto Route 23 || 2000 {{dungeontokens}} || Machoke & Moltres |}
